anniversary_calendar.title: Iran Historical Anniversary Calendar
anniversary_calendar.purpose: Auto-generate historically-grounded tweets on significant dates
anniversary_calendar.description: Every date is an opportunity to connect past to present

january.description: Carter, Giscard, Callaghan, Schmidt agree Shah must go. Gave green light to Khomeini.
january.significance: Western betrayal moment - enabled theocratic takeover
january.tweetAngle: On this day in 1979, four Western leaders decided Iran's fate without Iranians. They chose Khomeini over democracy. 47 years later, Iranians are undoing that choice themselves.

january.description: Seminary students protest article insulting Khomeini. Police kill several. Sparks 40-day mourning cycles leading to revolution.
january.significance: The spark that lit the 1978-79 revolution
january.tweetAngle: January 9, 1978: Qom. The spark that became a revolution. January 2026: Tehran Bazaar. History doesn't repeat, but it rhymes.

january.description: Mohammad Reza Shah departs Iran 'on vacation.' Never returns. Dies in Egypt 1980.
january.significance: End of 2,500 years of monarchy, beginning of theocracy
january.tweetAngle: January 16, 1979: The Shah left. He thought he'd return. 47 years later, his son may complete what his father couldn't - a free Iran.

february.description: Ayatollah Khomeini returns from 15 years exile in France on Air France chartered flight.
february.tweetAngle: February 1, 1979: Khomeini flew from Paris on Air France. Western capitals celebrated. 47 years and millions of victims later, Iranians are finally undoing that day.

february.description: Last Shah loyalist military units surrender. Revolution complete.
Regime's official celebration of revolution. Regime holds rallies.
february.tweetAngle: The regime celebrates February 11 as 'Victory Day.' Victory for whom? For Khomeini who executed the revolutionaries. For theocrats who stole democracy. 2026 will give Iran a real victory.

february.description: Iran signs humiliating treaty with Russia, loses Caucasus territories forever.
february.significance: Iran's greatest national humiliation - used to criticize any 'sellout' deal
february.tweetAngle: February 21, 1828: Turkmenchay. Iran lost the Caucasus to Russia. 2021: Mullahs signed 25-year deal with China. Iranians called it 'new Turkmenchay.' Free Iran will be partner to all, client to none.

march.description: 100,000 women march in Tehran against mandatory hijab. Khomeini temporarily backs down.
march.significance: Women resisted from DAY ONE. Regime's first crisis.
march.tweetAngle: March 8, 1979: Just weeks after Khomeini took power, 100,000 women marched against mandatory hijab. They resisted from day one. 47 years later, 'Woman, Life, Freedom' finishes what they started.

march.description: Ancient Persian celebration predating Islam by millennia. Regime has tried to suppress.
march.tweetAngle: Nowruz has been celebrated for 3,000 years. The Islamic Republic is 47 years old. Which will survive? Happy New Year to all Iranians - this year, may freedom be your gift.

april.description: Sham referendum with only one choice: 'Islamic Republic - Yes or No?' 98% 'yes' claimed.
april.significance: No option for secular democracy, constitutional monarchy
april.tweetAngle: April 1, 1979: Iran's 'referendum' offered one choice: Islamic Republic - Yes or No? No option for democracy. No option for constitutional monarchy. 47 years later, Iranians are choosing for themselves.

june.description: Disputed election. Ahmadinejad declared winner despite evidence of fraud. Protests begin.
june.tweetAngle: June 2009: Iranians demanded 'Where is my vote?' The regime answered with bullets and Evin Prison. 17 years later, they're not asking anymore. They're taking their country back.

june.description: 26-year-old woman shot dead by Basij. Her death filmed, went viral. Symbol of Green Movement.
june.significance: Iconic martyr - her death galvanized movement
june.tweetAngle: June 20, 2009: Neda Agha-Soltan, 26, was shot through the heart in Tehran. Her dying moments went viral. She became a symbol. Now, thousands of Nedas are rising to finish what she started.

july.description: Tehran University students protest newspaper closure. Regime attacks dormitory, kills several.
july.tweetAngle: July 9, 1999: Students protested. Regime attacked their dormitory at night. Threw students from windows. That generation is now middle-aged. Their children are in the streets in 2026.

august.description: Mozaffar ad-Din Shah signs constitution. First in Islamic world. Parliament established.
august.significance: FOUNDATIONAL - proves Iran has democratic DNA
august.tweetAngle: August 5, 1906: Iran became the FIRST nation in the Islamic world with a constitution. Before Turkey. Before anyone. 120 years later, Iranians are still fighting for that same dream.

august.description: CIA/MI6 overthrow democratically elected PM Mossadegh. Restore Shah's absolute power.
august.significance: Original sin of US-Iran relations. Led to 1979.
august.tweetAngle: August 19, 1953: The CIA overthrew Iran's democracy. 26 years later, Iranians got revolution - but not freedom. 2026: They're finally getting both. This time, no one can steal it.

august.description: 377-470 burned alive in Abadan movie theater. Blamed on SAVAK. Actually: Islamist militants.
august.significance: CRITICAL PARALLEL - same tactic used in Rasht 2026
august.tweetAngle: August 19, 1978: Cinema Rex, Abadan. 420 burned alive. Blamed on Shah. Actually: Islamist militants. Same people who would soon rule Iran. Same tactic used in Rasht 2026. Same fire. Same killers.

september.description: Martial law declared. Troops fire on protesters in Tehran. 64-88 killed (regime later claimed thousands).
september.significance: Point of no return for 1978 revolution
september.tweetAngle: September 8, 1978: Black Friday. Troops fired on protesters at Jaleh Square. It was the point of no return. Every massacre has a Black Friday. 2026 has had many.

september.description: 22-year-old Kurdish woman dies in morality police custody. Sparks 'Woman, Life, Freedom' uprising.
september.tweetAngle: September 16, 2022: Mahsa Amini, 22, died in custody for 'improper hijab.' Her death sparked 'Woman, Life, Freedom.' The regime thought they crushed it. They only delayed it.

september.description: Saddam Hussein invades Iran. 8-year war begins. 500,000-1,000,000 dead.
september.significance: War consolidated regime power, created IRGC dominance
september.tweetAngle: September 22, 1980: Saddam invaded Iran. Expected Arabs of Khuzestan to defect. They fought FOR Iran. That's Iranian unity. No one can break it - not Saddam, not the mullahs.

november.description: Students storm US embassy. 52 Americans held 444 days. Khomeini uses to consolidate power.
november.tweetAngle: November 4, 1979: Students stormed the US Embassy thinking they were revolutionaries. Khomeini used them to purge liberals and leftists. They were tools for a theocratic coup. History's cruelest irony.

november.description: Gas price protests. Regime kills 1,500+ in one week. Deadliest crackdown since 1988.
november.significance: Proved regime willing to kill en masse
november.tweetAngle: November 2019: 1,500 killed in one week. The regime thought that would end dissent forever. It only created more martyrs. Their children are in the streets in 2026.

december.description: Tehran Bazaar protests over economic collapse. Spreads nationwide within days.
december.tweetAngle: December 28, 2025: It began at Tehran's Grand Bazaar. Merchants protesting the rial collapse. Within days: 31 provinces, 190 cities. The revolution 47 years in the making has begun.

usage_instructions.daily_check: Each morning, check if today matches any anniversary
usage_instructions.if_match: Generate tweet using provided angle or create new one
usage_instructions.multiple_dates: Prioritize most relevant to current events
usage_instructions.integration: Combine anniversary with breaking news when possible
usage_instructions.example: If Rasht massacre news on Aug 19, lead with Cinema Rex parallel

prompt_for_anniversary_tweet:
Today is {{date}}. On this date in {{year}}, {{event}} occurred.

Historical significance: {{significance}}

Current context: {{current_news}}

Generate a tweet that:
1. Connects this anniversary to the 2026 revolution
2. Uses the {{pattern}} synthesis pattern
3. Stays under 280 characters
4. Makes history feel alive and relevant
